intro: Achyronia garipensis, commonly known as the Turkish orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to Turkey. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, elongated flowers that typically bloom in late spring. The plant grows in rocky or forested areas, often in shaded environments, and requires specific humidity and temperature conditions to thrive. Its botanical features include a slender stem and lance-shaped leaves, with flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
